column4: anyone here familiar with the default python search paths on ubuntu?
please just ask your real question
can you show on a pastebin?  Perhaps by doing  « PYTHONPATH='WHATEVER' python -c 'import sys; print sys.path' »
yeah, one sec
also, what ubuntu version?
http://pastebin.com/JSCHaegB
what ubuntu version?
what's the output of « which python »?
which python gives /usr/bin/python which is a symlink to python2.7
it's weird that /usr/local shows up in there.  Do yo uknow what that's about?
well that first thing looks like it's something from pip
what do you have installed to /usr/local?
a few things
what things python-related? :)
there are a few things, a newer mercurial, some web stuff, pithos, and pip
though the package I'm trying to override is in /usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7
check for interesting .pth files I guess
in /usr/{,local/}lib/python2.7/dist-packages
ahh right on the money
eh?
that's what it is, a .pth file from when I used easy_install at one point
oh, ok
ok, I've got it from here, thanks for your help!
no problem
